com.ihealth.communication.manager

Class iHealthDevicesCallback

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ihealth.communication.manager.iHealthDevicesCallback

  • public abstract class iHealthDevicesCallback
extends java.lang.Object
    This abstract class is used to implement iHealth device callback

        Callback indicating when a iHealth device has found.
        Parameters:
        mac - iHealth device mac
        deviceType - iHealth device type
        rssi - The signal strength of iHealth device eg. -60

      • onScanDevice

                         java.lang.String deviceType,
                         int rssi,
                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> manufactorData)
        Callback indicating when a iHealth device has found.
        Parameters:
        mac - iHealth device mac
        deviceType - iHealth device type
        rssi - The signal strength of iHealth device eg. -60
        manufactorData - Additional information for iHealth device eg. {serialnumber=EE00352E, modenumber=KD-723 GG006}

      • onScanFinish

        public void onScanFinish()
        Callback indicating the Discovery finish.

      • onDeviceConnectionStateChange

        public void onDeviceConnectionStateChange(java.lang.String mac,
                                          java.lang.String deviceType,
                                          int status,
                                          int errorID)
        Callback indicating when a iHealth device has connected/disconnect/connecting/reconnecting.
        Parameters:
        mac - iHealth device mac
        deviceType - iHealth device type
        status - status of the connecting, connected, disconnect or reconnecting operation iHealthDevicesManager.DEVICE_STATE_CONNECTING iHealthDevicesManager.DEVICE_STATE_CONNECTIONFAIL iHealthDevicesManager.DEVICE_STATE_CONNECTED iHealthDevicesManager.DEVICE_STATE_DISCONNECTED iHealthDevicesManager.DEVICE_STATE_RECONNECTING
        errorID - The error of connect fail. For BT3.0, errorID: 1, you have to pair iHealth device with your phone on bluetooth page manually. For BLE, errorID: returned by android os api BluetoothGattCallback.onConnectionStateChange(BluetoothGatt, int, int).

      • onDeviceConnectionStateChange

        public void onDeviceConnectionStateChange(java.lang.String mac,
                                          java.lang.String deviceType,
                                          int status,
                                          int errorID,
                                          java.util.Map manufactorData)
        Callback indicating when a iHealth device has connected/disconnect/connecting/reconnecting.
        Parameters:
        mac - iHealth device mac
        deviceType - iHealth device type
        status - status of the connecting, connected, disconnect or reconnecting operation iHealthDevicesManager.DEVICE_STATE_CONNECTING iHealthDevicesManager.DEVICE_STATE_CONNECTIONFAIL iHealthDevicesManager.DEVICE_STATE_CONNECTED iHealthDevicesManager.DEVICE_STATE_DISCONNECTED iHealthDevicesManager.DEVICE_STATE_RECONNECTING
        errorID - The error of connect fail. For BT3.0, errorID: 1, you have to pair iHealth device with your phone on bluetooth page manually. For BLE, errorID: returned by android os api BluetoothGattCallback.onConnectionStateChange(BluetoothGatt, int, int).
        manufactorData - manufactorData Additional information for iHealth device eg. {subtype=abi, position=arm}. Attention: If (subtype=abi && position=unknown) , please charge the device fully， then tap the button for 10 seconds to reset the device.

      • onUserStatus

        public void onUserStatus(java.lang.String username,
                         int userStatus)
        Callback reporting the result of user status.
        Parameters:
        username - iHealth username
        userStatus - user status:

        1 New-user registration succeeded.

        2 User login succeeded.

        3 The user is iHealth user as well, measurement via SDK has been activated, and the data from the measurement belongs to the user.

        4 Testing without Internet connection succeeded.

        5 Userid/clientID/clientSecret verification failed.

        6 SDK has not been authorized.

        7 User has not been authorized.

        8 Internet error, verification failed.

        PS: The measurement via SDK will be operated in the case of 1-4, and will be terminated if any of 5-8 occurs. The interface needs to be re-called after analyzing the return parameters. SDK application requires Internet connection; there is 10-day tryout if SDK cannot connect Internet, SDK is fully functional during tryout period,but will be terminated without verification through Internet after 10 days.

      • onDeviceNotify

        public void onDeviceNotify(java.lang.String mac,
                           java.lang.String deviceType,
                           java.lang.String action,
                           java.lang.String message)
        Callback triggered as a result of a remote device message notification.
        Parameters:
        mac - iHealth device mac
        deviceType - iHealth type
        action - notification event
        message - notification message
